intro: Saurauia sugaui, commonly known as the Sugaui snowbell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and arranged in a dense, compact form. Saurauia sugaui is adapted to cold, humid environments and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
